fields.name: token
fields.description: Bearer token for authentication

records.name: BearerTokenConfig
records.description: Represents token for Bearer token authentication.

records.name: ClientConfiguration
records.description:
Configurations for the WebSocket client.
Following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the Client specific
configs.

|                                                                              |
|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| callbackService - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration             |
| subProtocols - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration                |
| customHeaders - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration               |
| idleTimeout - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration                 |
| secureSocket - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration                |
| maxFrameSize - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration                |
| webSocketCompressionEnabled - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration |
| handShakeTimeout - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration            |
| cookies - Copied from CommonClientConfiguration                     |

elementType.name: record {| ballerina/http:1.1.0-alpha5:CertValidationType type; int cacheSize; int cacheValidityPeriod; |}
record {| ballerina/http:1.1.0-alpha5:CertValidationType type; int cacheSize; int cacheValidityPeriod; |}

records.name: ClientSecureSocket
records.description: Configures the SSL/TLS options to be used for WebSocket client.

fields.name: subProtocols
fields.description: Negotiable sub protocols of the client

fields.name: customHeaders
fields.description: Custom headers, which should be sent to the server

fields.name: readTimeout
fields.description: Read timeout (in seconds) of the client. This is applicable only for the Sync client

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: SSL/TLS-related options

fields.name: maxFrameSize
fields.description:
The maximum payload size of a WebSocket frame in bytes
If this is not set, is negative, or is zero, the default frame size of 65536 will be used.

fields.name: webSocketCompressionEnabled
fields.description: Enable support for compression in the WebSocket

fields.name: handShakeTimeout
fields.description:
Time (in seconds) that a connection waits to get the response of
the webSocket handshake. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated with
an error.If the value < 0, then the value sets to the default value(300).

fields.name: cookies
fields.description: An Array of `http:Cookie`

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Configurations related to client authentication

fields.name: pingPongHandler
fields.description:
A service to handle ping/pong frames.
Resources in this service gets called on the receipt of ping, pong from the server

records.name: CommonClientConfiguration
records.description: Common client configurations for WebSocket clients.

records.name: CredentialsConfig
records.description: Represents credentials for Basic Auth authentication.

records.name: JwtIssuerConfig
records.description: Represents JWT issuer configurations for JWT authentication.

fields.name: host
fields.description: The host name/IP of the endpoint

fields.name: http1Settings
fields.description: Configurations related to HTTP/1.x protocol

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description:
The SSL configurations for the service endpoint. This needs to be configured in order to
communicate through WSS.

fields.name: timeout
fields.description:
Period of time in seconds that a connection waits for a read/write operation in the
initial upgrade request. Use value 0 to disable timeout

fields.name: server
fields.description: The server name which should appear as a response header

fields.name: webSocketCompressionEnabled
fields.description: Enable support for compression in WebSocket

fields.name: requestLimits
fields.description: Configurations associated with inbound request size limits

records.name: ListenerConfiguration
records.description: Provides a set of configurations for HTTP service endpoints.

records.name: ListenerHttp1Settings
records.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

records.name: Remote

records.name: RequestLimitConfigs

fields.name: subProtocols
fields.description: Negotiable sub protocol by the service

fields.name: idleTimeout
fields.description:
Idle timeout for the client connection. Upon timeout, `onIdleTimeout` resource (if defined)
in the server service will be triggered. Note that this overrides the `timeout` config
in the `websocket:Listener` which is applicable only for the initial HTTP upgrade request.

fields.name: maxFrameSize
fields.description:
The maximum payload size of a WebSocket frame in bytes.
If this is not set or is negative or zero, the default frame size which is 65536 will be used.

records.name: WSServiceConfig
records.description: Configurations for a WebSocket service.

objectTypes.name: PingPongService
objectTypes.description: The Websocket Sync client service type

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeTextMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Pushes text to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the text message to the connection, that message
will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: writeBinaryMessage
remoteMethods.description:
Pushes binary data to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the binary message to the connection,
that message will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: ping
remoteMethods.description: Pings the connection. If an error occurs while sending the ping frame to the server, that frame will be lost.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

remoteMethods.name: pong
remoteMethods.description:
Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection waits
until a close frame is received. If WebSocket frame is received from the remote endpoint
within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending
An `error` if an error occurs when sending

will be lost.

that message will be lost.

Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
frame will be lost.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection waits
until a close frame is received. If WebSocket frame is received from the remote endpoint
within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs when sending

Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs while closing the WebSocket connection
The text data sent by the server or an `error` if an error occurs when sending

Sends a pong message to the connection. If an error occurs while sending the pong frame to the connection, that
frame will be lost.

parameters.name: statusCode
parameters.description: Status code for closing the connection

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description:
Time to wait (in seconds) for the close frame to be received from the remote endpoint before closing the
connection. If the timeout exceeds, then the connection is terminated even though a close frame
is not received from the remote endpoint. If the value is < 0 (e.g., -1), then the connection
waits until a close frame is received. If the WebSocket frame is received from the remote
endpoint within the waiting period, the connection is terminated immediately.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurs while closing the WebSocket connection

clients.name: Client

parameters.name: s

returnParameters.description: An `error` an error occurred during the service attachment process or else nil

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description: Attaches a service to the listener.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener starting process

methods.name: 'start
methods.description: Starts the registered service programmatically.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener stopping process

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description: Stops the service listener gracefully. Already-accepted requests will be served before connection closure.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if an error occurred during the listener stop process

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description: Stops the service listener immediately. It is not implemented yet.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: The service that needs to be attached

returnParameters.description: An `error` an error occurred during the service attachment process or else nil

methods.name: attach
methods.description: Attaches a service to the listener.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if one occurred during detaching of a service or else `()`

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Detaches a Http or WebSocket service from the listener. Note that detaching a WebSocket service would not affect
The functionality of the existing connections.

methods.name: init
methods.description: Gets invoked during module initialization to initialize the listener.

otherMethods.description: Stops the service listener gracefully. Already-accepted requests will be served before connection closure.

otherMethods.name: immediateStop
otherMethods.description: Stops the service listener immediately. It is not implemented yet.

returnParameters.description: An `error` if one occurred during detaching of a service or else `()`

otherMethods.name: detach
otherMethods.description:
Detaches a Http or WebSocket service from the listener. Note that detaching a WebSocket service would not affect
The functionality of the existing connections.

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description:
This is used for creating Websocket server endpoints. An Websocket server endpoint is capable of responding to
remote callers. The `Listener` is responsible for initializing the endpoint using the provided configurations.

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Represents the cookies to be added

functions.name: addCookies
functions.description: Adds cookies to the custom header.

packages.name: websocket
packages.summary: This package provides an implementation for connecting and interacting with WebSocket endpoints. The package facilitates three types of network entry points as ‘Client’, ‘AsyncClient’, and ‘Listener’.
